entry.title: Test Automation Solution for PO7.5 to SAP Integration Suite Migration
entry.content:
Test Automation Solution for PO 7.5 to SAP Integration Suite Migration

Enterprises are transitioning away from legacy SAP Process Orchestration (PO) towards SAP Integration Suite as PO approaches end of life. While this migration promises better scalability and integration capabilities, it also brings a significant challenge of ensuring data consistency and integrity throughout the process without disrupting business users.

In any migration project, testing can consume around 40% to 50% of the overall effort if done manually. Manual testing is time-consuming and prone to human error. Complex interfaces, multiple test cases, and large volumes of data drives up the time and cost of testing. Thoroughly validating that the new environment behaves as expected is critical to a successful transition. This is where automated testing solutions comes into play, simplifying and accelerating the validation of migrated interfaces.

 We have built a test tool to extract, compare, and validate payloads between your legacy PO system and SAP Integration Suite. This tool simplifies and automates testing of migrated iFlows, making your transition smoother, faster, and more reliable.

Key Features of Our Test Automation Tool

  • Automates payload extraction from SAP PO 7.5: Extracts input and output messages from your existing PO environment. It establishes connectivity with the PO System and pulls the payload for testing.
  • Validates test cases directly against migrated flows in Cloud Integration : Run test scenarios on the target platform(SAP Integration Suite) to verify correctness of migration.
  • Compares output payloads across systems: Detect any mismatches or errors.
  • Supports various testing approach: Whether testing single or multiple interfaces, Our tool adapts to project needs. It supports regression testing.
  • Generates detailed, downloadable test reports: Gain visibility into test results with comprehensive  reports.
  • Alerts via mails in case of failures: Immediate notifications enable quick corrective actions.
  • Supports standard adapters.
  • Monitoring through quality management and governance dashboard.

Whether you are migrating a few interfaces or hundreds, test tool brings efficiency, visibility, and reliability to your testing process saving both time and cost.

Integrating our test automation tool into your migration strategy will help with:

  • Faster testing cycles that reduce the overall migration timeline.
  • Improved reliability with consistent, repeatable automated test runs.
  • Greater visibility into testing outcomes through detailed reports.
  • Enhanced confidence that migrated interfaces behave exactly as expected.
  • Scalability to handle migrations involving just a few interfaces or hundreds.

Ready to accelerate your PO migration testing during migration? Reach out to learn how our tool can simplify your migration from PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite and save time, reduce costs, and ensure a smooth migration.

entry.title: SuccessFactors adapter not fetching data in SAP CPI
entry.content:
Hi Experts

I have a really strange bug.  There is an iflow in our system that is supposed to fetch and sync data from SuccessFactors to an external servers. The fetched data shows up as attachment in the CPI monitoring. It is working perfectly fine in our dev and test tenant. But when the client is trying to run it, it completes the run successfully but does not fetch any data at all. I am at a loss to understand what is going wrong. The endpoints they are using are exactly the same as ours. I asked them to run it in trace mode and share the results. Here is what they found -

This is showing up after a groovy script -

I am not sure why this error is coming up for them. Here is the "Set Content Name ppty" Script

/* Refer the link below to learn more about the use cases of script.
https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/148851bf8192412cba1f9d2c17f4bd25.html

If you want to know more about the SCRIPT APIs, refer the link below
https://help.sap.com/doc/a56f52e1a58e4e2bac7f7adbf45b2e26/Cloud/en-US/index.html */
import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;
import java.util.HashMap;
import groovy.json.JsonSlurper;
import groovy.json.JsonOutput;
import groovy.json.*;


def Message processData(Message message) {
    //Body
    def body = message.getBody(java.lang.String) as String;
    def jsonSlurper = new JsonSlurper();
    def payload = jsonSlurper.parseText(body);
    
    if (payload['root']['value'] == "") {
        message.setProperty("contentName", 'Not found');
    } else {
        def tyOfValue = payload['root']['value']['componentTypeID']
        message.setProperty("contentName", tyOfValue);
        
    }
    
    
    return message;
}

 For context, they are getting the payload when trying via postman. I am completely lost on this and any help will be appreciated.

Thank You

entry.title: Re: Query on Price Determination and Error Handling Durin...
entry.content:
You need to go for an enhancement to achieve this requirement. For that explore Workflow and BAdI validation.

Implement a workflow rule that checks the contract validity date against the current date. If the contract is expired, the workflow can:

  • Prevent PO approval.
  • Route the PO for manual review.
  • Trigger a warning or error message.

Use BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PO_FLX_PROCESS or similar (if available in Public Cloud) to inject custom logic during PO creation. You can validate:

  • Whether the contract referenced is still valid.
  • Whether the PIR price is being used despite an expired contract.

So with the above, the recommended approach is combine workflow validation + BAdI logic to enforce contract validity checks. Ensure that contract reference in PO is mandatory, and that the system checks its validity during creation. Optionally, use Fiori apps like ‚ÄúManage Purchase Contracts‚Äù to monitor and proactively update expired contracts.

entry.title: Re: Using T.code ME2ON User able to create multiple deliv...
entry.content:
One option is you can try with BAdI: MB_DOCUMENT_BADI or ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST. These BAdIs allow custom logic during PO processing or goods movement. You can implement a check to:

  • Query existing deliveries for the PO item.
  • Prevent creation of a new delivery if one already exists.

The other option is maintain a custom flag or Z-table to track delivery status per PO item. Before allowing delivery creation, check this flag and block if already delivered.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights
entry.content:
To get an overview of my personal highlights, you are welcome to share a few minutes and watch my highlight video below.

In the sections that follow, we‚Äôll explore how these intelligent capabilities are enabling transformation across your ERP operations. 

 

 

Unleashing intelligence: SAP business AI and Joule AI agents at the forefront

Finance: Streamlining account receivables with Joule agent

In the area of Finance, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces the beta version of the Joule agent for Accounts Receivables, contributing to financial management by streamlining overdue receivables analysis. Acting as a virtual assistant, the agent swiftly identifies overdue payments, provides detailed summaries, and recommends actionable next steps, transforming traditional analysis into strategic decision-making. It offers comprehensive insights into outstanding balances, open invoices, and disputes, empowering finance teams to improve cash flow management and reduce risk. This innovation allows accountants to focus on proactive financial strategies, enhancing operational efficiency. Stay tuned for the general availability release of this game-changing tool.

For more details, visit the SAP Help Portal and check out our demo video below.

Supply Chain: Optimized warehouse operations with AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning

Speaking of the Supply Chain area, SAP Cloud ERP Private's AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning is enhancing warehouse operations by addressing labor shortages and rising delivery demands with greater confidence. Imagine your warehouse managers equipped to forecast short- and mid-term workload changes using both historical and real-time data. This innovative solution allows for precise planning of resources and workloads, improving efficiency in managing outbound delivery orders.

The tool provides seamless access to interactive charts and key performance indicators (KPIs), helping managers to monitor, analyze, and anticipate labor demand. Integrated with SAP Smart Business, it leverages AI to offer forecasts on planned and future workloads, enabling supervisors to better plan shifts, enhance transparency, and minimize potential delays. As a result, businesses boost customer satisfaction by ensuring timely delivery fulfillment.

 For more details on this solution, visit the SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

Service Management: Equipment insights with Joule

In Service Management area, gaining a 360¬∞ view of equipment life cycles can transform your operational approach. With Joule integration, managers can assess equipment details, warranty information, and active service transactions, gaining insights into both customer and vendor warranties. AI-generated summaries capture the nuances of parts replaced and recurring issues, while offering recommendations for proactive management. This depth of information empowers service managers to make informed decisions, streamline operations, and enhance overall equipment effectiveness.

For more details, visit the SAP Help Portal and check out our demo video below.

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement: Purchase requisitions with AI-powered assistance

In the Sourcing and Procurement space, we are happy to introduce AI-assisted self-service requisitioning, simplifying the way purchase requisitions are created. Imagine casual users effortlessly engaging with Joule, an intuitive assistant that streamlines data entry and intelligently interprets misspelled information. This makes the requisition process accessible and user-friendly, eliminating the need for extensive navigation through multiple interfaces. Beyond just simplifying data input, Joule also leverages advanced language processing to understand and facilitate requests in diverse user languages, enhancing accuracy and efficiency. As a glimpse into the future, speech recognition promises to further reduce complexity, while simultaneously supporting purchasers by identifying sources of supply swiftly and minimizing reliance on free text items.

 Eager to learn more? Consult our SAP Help Portal.

 

Sales: Resolving sales order fulfillment challenges with AI assistance

In the sales area, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces an AI-assisted sales order fulfillment process with Joule, designed to seamlessly address delivery, invoice, and supply challenges. Imagine having an assistant that not only identifies but explains the intricacies of fulfillment issues, spanning incomplete data, credit holds, billing discrepancies, and trade compliance blocks. As questions arise, Joule provides clear, AI-generated explanations of interconnected issues, displayed in an intuitive carousel format. Beyond resolving queries, it supports inquiries about supply chain and invoicing problems, as well as journal entry creation, making the entire process more transparent and manageable. This innovative tool streamlines sales operations, ensuring smoother transactions and greater clarity.

For further insights, explore the SAP Help Portal.

Now, let‚Äôs explore further innovations of the current release across various lines of business.

 

Turning data into value: A unified data foundation with SAP Business Data Cloud

In today‚Äôs enterprise landscape, data is the engine of transformation. With SAP Business Data Cloud, organizations can unify and govern their most valuable data ‚Äì across SAP and third-party sources ‚Äì enabling real-time insights and smarter decisions at every level. 

 

A unified data foundation for every business need

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 delivers seamless integration with SAP Business Data Cloud, providing a governed, harmonized data layer that supports analytics, planning, and AI-driven innovation. This foundation breaks down silos and ensures that leaders have access to trusted, business-ready data. 

For more information, consult our page on integration with SAP Business Data Cloud.

Industry-ready data products

The release introduces a broad set of data products tailored for diverse business scenarios:

  • Convergent invoicing: Data products for billing requests, plans, and documents enable near-real-time analytics and interactive dashboards.
  • Contract accounting: Rich data products for contract accounts, provider contracts, and accounting documents support deeper financial analysis.
  • Subscription management: Data products for subscription orders, contracts, and agreements provide actionable insights for recurring revenue models.
  • Manufacturing: Unified manufacturing data ‚Äì such as production orders, confirmations, and work centers ‚Äì empowers leaders to optimize operations. Eager to learn more on manufacturing data products? Consult our SAP Help portal.
  • Product lifecycle management: Enhanced data products for bills of material, engineering change masters, and change records drive better product and change management. For more information, click here.

 

From data to action: Working capital dashboard

A standout example is the working capital dashboard for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud. By leveraging harmonized data from finance, procurement, and supply chain, this dashboard gives finance leaders real-time visibility into cash flow, receivables, and payables ‚Äì enabling proactive, data-driven decisions to optimize working capital.

 

SAP Business Data Cloud is not just a technology layer ‚Äì it‚Äôs the strategic enabler that turns data into value, powering the next wave of business transformation.

 

Strengthening the core: Innovations in business applications

 

Finance

Taulia: Contributing to cash flow and supply chain resilience 

Additionally, SAP Cloud ERP Private's integration with SAP Taulia benefits cash flow optimization and supply chain resilience. By leveraging real-time data insights, businesses enhance cash management and strengthen supplier relationships, allowing precise management of early payments and discounts. This boosts liquidity, enabling reinvestment in growth while maintaining supply chain stability. The integration streamlines financial processes, fostering transparency and a robust dialogue between buyers and suppliers. Empowered to manage cash flow proactively and reduce risks, organizations achieve greater agility and resilience.

 For more insights, explore SAP Help Portal.

 

Supply Chain

Streamlining order management with aATP Innovation

The current release introduces important enhancements to the Advanced Available-to-Promise (aATP) capabilities, designed to make order management more intelligent and efficient. These capabilities aim to instill confidence in order confirmations while simultaneously reducing inventory carrying costs, delivering tangible business benefits from the outset.

Picture a business environment where timely delivery is key to customer satisfaction and brand reputation. The new features enable companies to confirm orders with confidence, capitalizing on advanced backorder processing. This flexibility allows users to bypass traditional constraints such as Product Availability Check (PAC), Product Allocation (PAL), and Supply Protection (SUP). As a result, businesses can reliably and accurately fulfill customer needs, ensuring the loyalty that comes from dependable service.

The innovation further streamlines logistics by automating transport order creation, facilitating the smooth movement of stock from substitute locations to the requested site. This automation reduces the need for manual intervention, minimizing errors, and promoting a seamless logistics process. Imagine the operational relief this brings, letting companies dedicate resources to strategic tasks rather than repetitive logistics management.

By introducing efficient availability checks for configured and long products, businesses achieve effective inventory management. This ensures readiness aligns perfectly with demand, paving the way for higher fulfillment rates and precise delivery dates, enhancing overall customer satisfaction.

Additionally, we are happy to introduce the Alternative-Based Confirmation with Stock Transport Document Creation, a feature designed to streamline and improve logistical processes. This innovation allows businesses to consolidate shipments by ensuring that sales order items ship from the originally requested location rather than alternative stock-holding sites. This is particularly beneficial in maintaining a consistent supply chain, reducing the chances of logistical errors.

In the context of international shipping, this feature proves invaluable. It ensures goods are consolidated at locations best suited for tariff and tax declarations, thereby facilitating smoother, compliant export processes. Companies can navigate complex export requirements more confidently, knowing that their logistical operations support rather than hinder compliance.

 

Activation of this feature is notably flexible, accommodating various sales order characteristics. It automates stock reservations and generates necessary transportation documents as the orders are saved, reducing the manual workload associated with these tasks. This automation enhances the accuracy of transportation planning and scheduling, ensuring that these tasks align perfectly with business needs.

Eager to learn more? Consult this dedicated page  on SAP Help portal.

 

Service Management

Enhancing internal logistics: Optimized management of in-house service objects

Additionally, we are introducing a noteworthy advancement with the intracompany logistics feature for in-house service objects. This functionality empowers businesses to efficiently manage service objects within the same company code, enhancing logistical operations and resource utilization. It allows for the seamless transfer of an in-house service object between plants or storage locations, utilizing existing customer stock effectively. This capability not only optimizes space and resources but also streamlines internal logistics processes, ensuring service objects are handled with increased precision.

Businesses can now define and display the plant and storage locations of service objects, providing clearer visibility and control over inventory management. Furthermore, receiving service objects is made more efficient through the introduction of options to receive them directly via inbound delivery. This directly addresses the need for improved logistical coordination within companies, facilitating a more synchronized workflow when handling service objects.

Choosing between customer stock B and returns order stock E offers flexibility in how service objects are managed based on specific business requirements. The graphical process flow provides access to logistics-related documents, helping users quickly ascertain the status and movement of service objects. Additionally, receiving service objects at specified plant or storage locations, and reviewing their current location on the UI, enhances day-to-day operational efficiency and accuracy.

For more details, explore the SAP Help portal.

 

Driving agility: Real-time service management with enhanced service transactions

In today's dynamic business environment, flexibility is paramount for companies looking to stay competitive. In the current release, we introduce one more subtle yet powerful enhancement to service management area: the integration of plant and storage location fields within service transaction items. This advancement isn‚Äôt just a technical upgrade; it's a strategic lever for businesses aiming to enhance their operational agility.

Imagine a scenario where your company needs to rapidly adjust service delivery due to sudden market changes or resource constraints. With these new capabilities, changing the plant and storage location directly in service transactions becomes seamless, enabling you to adapt your logistics in real-time. This flexibility means that resources can be reallocated swiftly, improving response times and aligning services more closely with customer expectations.

Such adaptability transforms how businesses manage their logistics, turning service operations into a strategic advantage rather than a mere necessity. The ability to dynamically adjust service parameters according to evolving business needs not only streamlines processes but also ensures that service delivery remains efficient and customer-centric.

To dive into further details, don‚Äôt hesitate to explore the SAP Help portal page.

 

Asset Management

Streamlined maintenance strategies: Enhancing asset health

In the realm of asset management, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces the beta version of enhancements with Maintenance Planner and Maintenance Order Management, integrating seamlessly with Joule to improve how maintenance is orchestrated. Consider a planner working hand-in-hand with an intelligent agent, dynamically analyzing real-time data to fine-tune maintenance schedules and improve asset health. Joule leverages technical object details to create maintenance planning buckets, offering planners a clear view of upcoming events and enabling seamless assignment of orders and notifications. Additionally, by checking available slots and reserving production capacities for future operations, downtime is minimized, fostering a more proactive maintenance approach. This integrated system not only optimizes workflows but empowers teams to make informed decisions, ensuring that assets remain in prime condition.

For more details, explore the SAP Help Portal.

 

Optimizing asset management: Tailored efficiency in maintenance operations

In the asset management landscape, SAP Cloud ERP Private enhances the ‚ÄúManage Maintenance Orders‚Äù app to empower businesses with greater efficiency and customization. Imagine a streamlined operation where you effortlessly customize fields and processes to fit your unique needs. This app now allows batch editing of maintenance orders and the inclusion of multiple task lists, simplifying complex workflows and maximizing resource utilization. Picture the ease of linking business partners directly to orders, ensuring transparency and fostering stronger collaborations. This enhanced visibility ensures smoother communication and stronger partnerships, ultimately leading to improved service delivery and outcomes.

Interested to learn more? Click here!

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement

Precision in procurement: Elevating efficiency with synchronized service timelines

In the context of SAP procurement, timing is everything. SAP Cloud ERP Private‚Äôs latest enhancement allows for seamless transfer of lean service start and end dates to connected backend systems, shifting the focus from traditional delivery dates to precise service durations.

Visualize a scenario where procurement teams can boost efficiency significantly by having accurate service timelines at their disposal. This synchronization ensures that everyone, from procurement officers to backend users, operates with the same timeline data, reducing discrepancies and enhancing planning accuracy. With this new capability, businesses gain a strategic advantage, as coordinated planning between departments becomes the norm rather than the exception.

Think of the impact on your business: with synchronized service data, your teams can efficiently coordinate with service providers, ensuring that every commitment is met with precision. This results in improved operational harmony and more reliable partnerships. This innovative feature boosts your procurement efficiency, aligning strategic objectives with everyday operations. For more details on how this can transform your processes, explore the linked page.  

 

Sales

Enhancing sales efficiency with one-step-payment

In the ever-evolving landscape of digital commerce, SAP Cloud ERP Private now empowers businesses to streamline their sales processes through pre-order payments. This innovation allows customers to make payments even before a sales order is created, seamlessly integrating payment details into the sales order via an API. By carrying over liability and payment details to the finance application, businesses can efficiently match liabilities against payments, simplifying settlements and reducing days sales outstanding (DSO). This enhancement not only enhances liquidity and reduces financing costs but also appeals to customers who prefer paying upfront, offering a more flexible purchasing experience. Furthermore, it facilitates faster incoming digital payments, reassuring customers with the stability and responsiveness of a modern finance system.

Want to learn more about Payment Processing? Check out our SAP Help Portal.

 

Manufacturing

Seamless production alignment with advanced MRP solutions

In a quest to enhance operational efficiency, we are introducing innovative features for Material Requirements Planning (MRP) in Manufacturing area. The Accept MRP Run Result functionality allows production planners to flag specific segments as processed, streamlining decision-making by focusing on issues that truly need attention. This improvement, coupled with the ability to use a new filter field, empowers end users to efficiently analyze material coverage for thousands of materials daily, marking a significant enhancement in workflow efficiency. Additionally, the Manage Material Coverage app now offers rescheduling proposals, enabling planners to realign MRP elements by rescheduling or canceling as necessary. These real-time adjustments ensure that manufacturing requirements are always met as planned, minimizing disruptions and maintaining smooth production flows. With the option to invoke or revoke MRP results, businesses gain flexibility in their planning processes, adapting swiftly to changing demands. Ultimately, this upgrade facilitates a more agile and responsive manufacturing environment, ensuring that production aligns seamlessly with demand predictions.

 

For more details, explore the our dedicated pages on accept planning result of MRP run and rescheduling proposals for MRP elements.    

 

Cross Topics

Enhancing business engagement through integrated communications

With the current release, SAP Cloud ERP Private improves organizations‚Äô ability to craft and deliver personalized, traceable communications seamlessly within their existing workflows. This innovation ensures consistent and timely interactions with business contacts by setting up automated, multi-step communication flows that operate both regularly and in response to specific events. By allowing ad-hoc communications directly from the current process step, businesses maintain critical context without ever leaving the system. This not only enhances productivity and transparency but also significantly boosts customer satisfaction by providing tailored communication that meets the unique needs of each business partner. With these capabilities, organizations can foster stronger relationships industry-wide, ensuring every message is delivered effectively and efficiently.

 

For more insights, please refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Elevating master data governance with Joule copilot

In the quest for seamless data management, SAP introduces an innovation that empowers business users to engage with business partner data through natural language dialogs in Joule Copilot. This advancement provides a consumer-grade user experience, simplifying the processes of searching, displaying, creating, and modifying data within SAP Master Data Governance. By integrating this intuitive interaction capability, users can effortlessly participate in master data processing, enhancing both their effectiveness and the overall speed of data governance. The automation and ease of use offered by Joule Copilot significantly elevate the handling of business partner data, allowing businesses to maintain accurate and timely records with minimal effort. This innovation stands as a testament to the commitment to user-friendly technology that aligns with modern business needs.

 Simplifying process check complexities with Joule copilot

Moreover, the integration of Joule copilot, helps tackling the complexity of the data governance processes by laying bare with the simplicity of natural language dialog. From now on, users can seamlessly search for and display governance processes in cloud-ready mode, including vital approval information. There's no need for extensive training or additional tools, business users can now harness advanced functions within SAP Master Data Governance intuitively. This empowerment transforms how teams interact with data, enabling them to make informed decisions swiftly and accurately. By simplifying the understanding of governance processes, businesses can ensure compliance and streamline operations.

 

Improved user experience: Seamless navigation with WalkMe integration

Imagine having a virtual guide that not only navigates the complexities of SAP Cloud ERP Private edition but boosts efficiency and confidence. Integrating WalkMe with SAP Cloud ERP Private improves user engagement by offering intuitive in-app guidance akin to a personal assistant, easing the learning curve for new users. This seamless interaction accelerates software adoption, reducing training time and automating repetitive tasks for heightened efficiency. As users navigate system upgrades or new processes, WalkMe‚Äôs role-specific guidance ensures confidence and competence, thereby transforming potential challenges into manageable steps. By providing actionable insights into user behavior, WalkMe empowers users to resolve issues independently, which enhances IT efficiency and reduces support demands.

 

Register for the SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training 2025!

The SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training is a biannual multi-day event designed to empower partners with in-depth knowledge of the latest features and AI-driven innovations. 

For the first time, we‚Äôre covering the full range of SAP Business Suite, incl. topics such as SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), Spend Management, Supply Chain Management (SCM), Customer Experience (CX), Human Capital Management (HCM), and more, setting a new benchmark in SAP training.

Join this event to maximize customer success and stay ahead of the rapidly evolving digital landscape.

  • From October 6-17, we cover SAP Cloud ERP, Cloud LoB, and SAP SCM
  • From October 27-31, we cover SAP Cloud ERP Private, Cloud LoB, and SAP SCM

Check out the detailed agenda on this landing page and register now.

 

Summary

As we explore the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release, it's impressive to see how these innovations integrate advanced technology with intelligent business processes. From enhancing finance management to improving supply chain operations and service quality, these advancements are designed to support companies in the future.

I encourage you to delve deeper into the specific business and industry-focused innovations in upcoming blog posts. Connect with us on our community page to engage with our experts, raise your queries, and share insights.

Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag. Don't forget to follow me at BeSchulze in the community and on LinkedIn to catch all the updates and insights.

Together, let's work towards a more connected and efficient ERP future.

Best wishes,
Bert

entry.title: Re: SAP Joule for Developers Expands to Private Cloud: Accelerating ABAP Innovation and Transformat
entry.content:
@pokrakam 

Hi,
SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities has already been released for public cloud (SAP BTP ABAP environment and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) and as of today SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 is now also supported. Support for older versions of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is planned as well, see https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/abap-ai-chapter-2/ba-p/14210568 for details.
The AI-based use cases for custom code migraton are planned to be integrated into the Custom Code Migration app running on SAP BTP ABAP environment which typically connects to your existing ECC landscape.

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Public Cloud ‚Äì F2 billing: Number range inter...
entry.content:
Not sure whether you checked or not. If not, go to Define Number Ranges for Billing Documents in the production system and manually verify that the interval 19 has valid ‚Äúfrom‚Äù and ‚Äúto‚Äù values. In Public Cloud, number range intervals are not always transported correctly from the quality system to production. Even if the interval exists in your source system, the ‚Äúfrom‚Äù and ‚Äúto‚Äù numbers might be missing in the target system.

If Flexible Billing Document Numbering is active, the system may dynamically select a number range based on header fields (e.g., company code, billing type). If the logic points to a number range that‚Äôs not properly defined or missing, you‚Äôll get this error. Check if flexible numbering is active and review the logic/rules in the configuration environment.

Even though number range key 00 exists, it must be defined for the specific fiscal year. Double-check that the number range for key 00 is maintained for the current fiscal year in the posting company code.

entry.title: Company Structure Overview and duplicate objects displayed
entry.content:
Let's start by defining our Company Structure, usually we find the Business Unit as the highest level in the hierarchy, followed by the Divisions and the rest of the structure is defined using parent child department relationship.

In this scenario our department object will have 2 associations one to division and another one to parent department. 

Because the Company Structure overview relays on the associations to display the structure, the department will be displayed twice, once under the division and another one under the parent department.

Department configuration

Let me show you a workaround to avoid this duplication

1. Add a custom field - division on Department object. this field should be read only

2. We create a Rule triggered on Save on Department object, that automatically populates the data from the standard association field to the new custom_division field in case the Parent department value is null

The custom division field should only be updated in case the Parent Department is not empty

3. Update the Company Structure Overview to display the new field instead of standard association

4. Go to Company Structure Overview and display the results. The Department no longer appear duplicated

5. Position and job info filters to departments will remain the same

Hope this can make your Company Structure easier to set up and maintain 

Please also take into consideration the useful information and configurations shared on IDP ( implementation Design Principle) IDP Employee Central Core Hybrid - Organization Structure Design Consideration V2.0.pdf

This IDP will provide you also more clarity on the set up and design of the Organization Structure

entry.title: Re: How to enable smart link with Action CDS view tile
entry.content:
Hello @Raghavendar 

In addition to @Maciej__Galica  comment,

You cannot restrict the Smart Link popover to a single action. By design, it lists all target mappings for a semantic object
To navigate directly to the Manage G/L Account app, use intent-based navigation via DataFieldForIntentBasedNavigation instead of @Consumption.semanticObject.

Useful SAP Documentation References

Smart Link popover behaviour (lists all actions):

  • SAP Fiori Design Guidelines ‚Äì Smart Link
  • SAPUI5 API Reference ‚Äì sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink

Intent-based navigation annotations:

  • SAP Help Portal ‚Äì ABAP CDS: DataFieldForIntentBasedNavigation

Target app reference:

  • SAP Fiori Apps Library ‚Äì Manage G/L Account Master Data (V2) (App ID F0731A)


Smart Link is a popover with an unlimited number of actions. Use DataFieldForIntentBasedNavigation with General Ledger Account/manage for a straightforward, one-click access to Manage G/L Account.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Highlights of Transportation Management in SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition 2025
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA 2025 and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 were released today.

Transportation Management is included in this release and offers impressive innovations.
I am excited to share the latest updates with you in this blog post.

One of the most important highlights of this release is the integration of Transportation Management with

Lean Service Procurement

The biggest advantage of working with Lean Service Procurement in TM is that freight charge invoicing is much more transparent, and invoice verification is simplified, reducing total operating costs.

This contrasts with the established integration (which is still available) of invoice verification with TM, where only the total TM costs were visible on the invoice. Now, charge items are displayed individually on the invoice. For the user responsible for checking invoices, it's much easier to validate the correctness of an incoming invoice against the calculated costs from TM because they can see all the charge items in the system and easily compare them with the individual items on an incoming (B2B or paper) invoice.

Overall, a harmonized process is introduced across S/4HANA for invoicing purchased services, and visibility into the freight charge invoicing process is significantly improved. Additionally, universal parallel accounting is enabled.

 

Graph of the Integration of the new lean service procurement process into Transportation Management and Invoicing

 

How is this new process enabled? The basis for this new type of charge settlement is that charge types are directly matched with independent service materials and dependent charge types are linked with the technique of conditions. This makes it easy to visualize unplanned charges during the invoicing process and allows purchasers to enter them directly into the manual invoice verification process.

Freight Order charge items, mapping and visibility in the carrier invoice

 

Of course, the carrier may have already made corrections to charge items in advance, e.g., in collaboration apps during ERS (evaluated receipt settlement) or self-billing, to avoid discrepancies in invoice verification. This means that a dispute case was created and resolved in advance. Dispute management in TM is also supported with lean service procurement integration.

The new lean service procurement introduces new apps for the accrual process. With these apps create and post accruals can be triggered after a certain status is reported in a freight execution document (e.g., checked out, departed, shipped on board, or uplifted). 

 New Apps for Freight Accruals with snapshot of all charge items of a freight document

 

Along with this innovation, background reports are provided to automate the process.

Another important aspect is that customers upgrading to the new Lean Service Procurement integration are supported with reports to ensure a smooth transition and consistent settings in agreement management.

The new Lean Service Procurement integration also enabled and enhanced the natively available Carrier Collaboration Apps. What's new with the

Carrier Collaboration Apps

In previous releases, it was already possible to manage freight order charges or create an invoice with carrier collaboration apps. This process has been improved in many ways. For example, you can now create and recall invoices submitted in the self-billing process. This feature is useful when the LSP or carrier wants to correct and resubmit an invoice. If the carrier has changed or added charge items, meaning a dispute exists, the dispute case will be canceled automatically when the invoice is recalled, depending on the status of the dispute case.

A further invoicing feature is the ability to create a note when creating a credit memo to explain why a credit memo is being created.

Recall of an invoice

A very useful new feature for managing invoices is the ability to delete or exclude charge items from an invoice.

In a freight order, additional invoicing parties may exist, e.g., for charging service or pre-carriage fees. Now, it is possible to manage charges for a freight order and run all invoicing processes for additional parties in Collaboration Apps the same way as for the main carrier. Only the relevant charge items will be displayed to the relevant carriers, as calculated in the freight order.

Display of charge items in the invoicing app of the carrier collaboration apps

 

Many transportation planners have been waiting a long time for the following great innovation.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in the Transportation Cockpit

In this release, we focused on the most important KPIs for road transportation and made them available for the freight order list, freight unit stages, and truck resources.  In total, we deliver 93 standard KPIs from various categories.

  • Utilization
  • Quantity (weight, volume, etc.)
  • Distance
  • Duration
  • CO2 emissions
  • Costs

The KPIs displayed are defined with the help of a KPI profile and can be enhanced based on customer needs.
The profile allows you to freely define the sequence and choose the respective KPIs, as well as the display of delta values, previous values, or colors. These can be updated depending on set thresholds.
KPIs are calculated and updated after each planning step. This allows planners to quickly see how KPIs change and visualize their impact next to the KPI.
This improved transparency of KPIs during the planning process helps planners make better decisions, which ultimately leads to improved transportation plans.

Display of the KPIs and impact after planning changes

 

There are also many other enhancements in the transportation cockpit. I would like to mention the most important ones. Further details can be found here: KPI area in Transportation Cockpit

  • Distance (Empty) and Distance (Loaded).
    We introduced new fields for distance (empty) and distance (loaded) for road and rail freight orders, as well as for container, trailer, and railcar units in the Transportation Cockpit and in the single document UIs. This gives planners more transparency into whether a resource is traveling empty or loaded.
  • In the road freight order hierarchy, it is now possible to group by driver. Now, planners can easily visualize the freight orders planned for drivers.
  • CO2 consumption for vehicle types/resources.
    Now, planners can see the CO2 consumption for resources (empty, partly loaded, or fully loaded). This helps them, for example, choose the most efficient resource for manual planning and reduce CO2 emissions.
  • We have added actions and fields in the Transportation Cockpit for subcontracting freight and rail freight orders, consignment orders, and air and ocean bookings.

Various other innovations in Transportation Planning & Network

Various other innovations in Transportation Planning & Network

In addition to the innovations in the transportation cockpit, as with every release, many innovations are provided in transportation planning and networks. Here, I will mention only the major innovations.

  • Extend the capabilities of the freight unit building with more items and further splitting criteria.
    It is now possible for freight unit building to use unloading points as hard split criteria. This is particularly useful for advanced shipping and receiving.
    The system also allows for 999 splits in freight unit building.
  • Consider driver availability in embedded scheduling and the vehicle scheduling and routing (VSR) optimizer. This means that driver unavailability, as defined in the validity period of drivers and resources, is considered. These periods of unavailability are also displayed in the Gantt chart.
  • Replanning and rescheduling by VSR during execution.
    This is an important feature because it allows you to reschedule follow-up activities that have already started or are in progress, enabling you to respond to delays during execution.
  • Appointments in the transportation cockpit.
    We have added fields for appointments to the field list for the transportation cockpit.
  • We have enabled PTV Developer as an additional geographic service provider in SAP HANA Spatial Services Integration. The following service providers are now supported: HERE, TomTom, Trimble, PC*Miler, ESRI, and PTV Developer. 

 

TM based Scheduling for Stock Transport Orders using BPS

As you may know, we introduced TM-based scheduling for sales orders with S/4Hana 2023. With this release, we are introducing TM-based scheduling using Business Process Scheduling for Stock Transport Orders as well. Similar to sales order integration, the scheduling can be even used if the stock transport order is not integrated with TM after the document is saved.

Like with sales order scheduling, the requested delivery is handed over to business processing. Available-to-promise (ATP), in combination with TM scheduling, is called, and, after either backward or forward scheduling, the confirmed delivery dates are returned. During the scheduling process in TM, the durations for loading, transport time, and unloading are calculated. The TM network, including the default route, schedule, straight distance, and relevant Incoterms locations, can be taken into account during scheduling.

Scheduling result in the stock transport order

 

Support cross delivery handling units in combination of EWM and TM in Advanced Shipping and Receiving (Adv. S&R)

With this release, we now support cross-delivery handling units (HUs) within for Advanced Shipping and Receiving Process in an Outbound scenario, for both transportation- and warehouse-driven Adv. S&R. This means it is now possible to combine multiple deliveries into one package if they are going to the same consignee.

In this process, multiple deliveries can be packaged together in the warehouse. These cross-delivery handling units can be integrated into TM in the context of advanced shipping and receiving.

Cross-delivery handling units are displayed as package items in the item hierarchy of the road freight order. 

 

Example how cross delivery HUs are displayed in the freight order

 

Advanced Shipping and Receiving supported for 2-step Stock Transport Order (STO) for EWM managed warehouse

With this feature, FUs are reassigned from outbound deliveries to inbound deliveries as soon as goods are issued from the issuing warehouse. So far, advanced shipping and receiving has not been supported for EWM-managed warehouses within the context of advanced S&R in the STO process. This process gap has now been closed.

Essentially, in an STO scenario, you have already used Adv. S&R for shipping on the outbound side. As soon as you report the goods issue, the FUs are reassigned to the inbound delivery. You can now also execute the process on the receiving side of the STO using the advanced shipping and receiving process if this warehouse is also EWM managed. This was already available previously e.g. for stockroom managed warehouses or LE warehouses. 

 

Reassignment of the freight unit after goods issue on outbound delivery

 

Global Trade Service (GTS) Integration: Update Export declaration after initial declaration

Another helpful new feature, developed primarily by the GTS team, is the updated export declaration. In the past, if there were changes to a freight order or container, the customs declaration had to be canceled, and a new export declaration was required. This is no longer necessary, as it‚Äôs now possible to update an initial export declaration with changed information, since GTS can work with updated information from TM.

Innovations in Freight Order Management

Simplified Multimodal Booking for Shippers

Simplified freight booking for ocean and air is already available on the public cloud. They provide a user interface (UI) and process that is closer to the LE-TRA process, offering stage-specific invoicing to carriers. Along with the simplified UI comes the ability to determine a valid agreement for all carriers, as well as the respective charge calculation for multiple carriers. The follow-on processes in settlement, such as the new lean service procurement integration, are also supported.

This simplified UI, with fewer buttons and fields, is now available to private cloud customers through the correct web dynpro application configuration assignment to the booking type.

Simplified Ocean Booking UI

 

Now, cargo that is ready for loading can be used to trigger integration with the Global Trade Service (GTS). This streamlines GTS processes and further automates integration with GTS for trade compliance.

Essentially, this new status can be integrated into the event profile. As soon as the "ready for loading" status is manually set, the customs invoice and export declaration requests can also be sent to the GTS system. With this in place, customs processing can be accelerated.

Another topic that simplifies processes, reduces manual effort, and streamlines freight order execution is the automatic setting of the "ready for transportation execution" status. This means that when any successor event is reported, such as the start of loading, the predecessor event "ready for transportation loading" can also be set.

Consignment orders can now also use subcontracting functionality. This means that freight units with the same source and destination that are grouped into one consignment can be subcontracted to a carrier. As with freight orders, consignment orders can be changed or canceled, and the full communication history is available in the document.

 

Integration to Product Compliance

There are also two new innovations regarding integration with Product Compliance.

While many functions were previously managed directly by TM, they are now called directly from Product Compliance, and the results are received and used in TM.

According to dangerous goods information, we introduced the mixed loading check using Product Compliance in four areas.

First, the mixed loading check has been added to the TM execution document checks. During the document check, all items relevant to Product Compliance are checked to see if they can be transported together. Unlike the current DG classic check, if items are physically separated (e.g., in a truck and trailer or in different containers), the document will no longer be blocked from execution.

Second, the mixed loading check considers product loading incompatibilities during freight unit building.

Third, during VSR optimization, mixed-loading incompatibilities are considered, and items may be planned on separate freight orders.

Lastly, mixed-loading incompatibilities are considered during load consolidation. Consequently, incompatible products are planned into different containers.

 

Mixed loading check during freight unit building and consolidation

 

There are more innovations related to product compliance which are 5 new dangerous goods print forms that are introduced. These are ADR goods note for road Europe, RID goods note for rail Europe, IMO declaration for ocean transports (which is created for the pick-up freight order), US & Canada Bill of Lading and enhancements to the existing CMR/Master Bill of Lading.

Examples of the new dangerous goods print forms

 

BN4L Integration of (Spot) tendering & Dispute Management for Ocean bookings

 

The integration tendering of road freight orders with business network for logistics (BN4L) is available since ever. Now it is also possible to use spot tendering of ocean bookings in the integration with BN4L.

Also, the dispute management functionality that is available since long time in combination with BN4L is now extended to be used with ocean bookings.

This means that the well-known process in case of disputes for charge items can now also be used in ocean related dispute cases.

Clean Core

Clean Core is not only a buzzword. It is very important to our customers to reduce modifications of standard functionality. To improve the Clean Core capabilities in TM, we have introduced further extensibility in TM.

For that purpose, we have delivered the clean core foundation with the help of basic CDS views for 7 nodes of TOR (Transporation Order) objects like TOR Root/Item/Stop/Stage/Execution/DocRef.

With the help of these new basic CDS views it‚Äôs much easier for customers to create own customer specific fields, add them to the TM data structures and backend tables and use them in the TM UIs.

Additionally, we have published SOA Webservices, like the SOAP Services for the Agreements in in the business accelerator hub.

Further details on the CDS views for the Transportation Order

 

That's it for today. This was the highlights of Transportation Management in S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition 2025. 

Stay tuned. S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition 2025 FP01 is already in the makings. There are great innovations on the way. 
If you are curious, then you can browse through details of upcoming releases and feature packages by checking the Roadmap Explorer for TM.

General further information can be found here:

  • What‚Äôs New Viewer
  • SAP TM Product Page on sap.com
  • SAP Community for Transportation Management
  • SAP Transportation Management Group on LinkedIn

In order to achieve automatic selection of Kerberos profile for SSO, you can refer following solution given in the KBA 3086403 - Selecting a Default Secure Login Client Profile For SAP Application Via Registry-Based Group Policy

Resolution

The use of the "GssTargetName" setting may be made in that regard, since depending on it's value and the application's context, a specific profile will be selected over others.

For that end, Microsoft group policies must be used to deploy this configuration.

entry.title: The new HCM EvoGuide: How SAP Is Helping HR and IT Leaders Move from SAP ERP HCM to the Cloud
entry.content:
When our team at SAP began creating ‚ÄúCharting a course from SAP ERP HCM to cloud-based human capital management solutions from SAP‚Äù, aka the HCM EvoGuide, we knew we weren‚Äôt just writing another technical guide. We were building a blueprint for one of the most significant shifts in HR and IT in decades - the move from traditional, on-premises SAP ERP Human Capital Management (HCM) systems to the cloud-based SAP SuccessFactors suite.

This transformation is about far more than technology. It‚Äôs about how organizations think about people, data, and change itself. From day one, we saw our mission as helping leaders not just migrate systems, but also to modernize their mindset.

Listening Before Writing

Before we drafted a single line, our SAP Customer Evolution team spent years listening to and learning from customers, partners, and members of SAP‚Äôs global HR and IT community. We held workshops with HRGUG, ASUG, and DSAG and their members and interviewed CIOs and HR leaders across industries.

Three common themes emerged:

  1. Complexity: Decades of customization had left many SAP ERP HCM systems deeply entangled. Modernization felt risky.
  2. Uncertainty: With the 2027 end-of-maintenance deadline approaching, organizations knew they needed to act but lacked a clear plan.
  3. Culture: HR and IT often approached transformation differently with one focused on process continuity, the other on innovation.

It became clear that our guide couldn‚Äôt just outline migration steps. It had to be a compass that helped leaders navigate choices, anticipate challenges, and manage both technical and human change.  The result is 140 pages of expert content, practical advice and useful links intended to help each customer to evolve HCM in ways that help their organizations not just to survive, but to thrive. 

Designing a Practical Compass

We structured the guide around three questions every leader faces when planning transformation:

  1. Why change? (Strategic Choices)
  2. How to prepare? (Ingredients for Project Success)
  3. With what tools? (Essential SAP Tools)

The first part clarifies why the shift to the cloud is not optional. With SAP ERP HCM reaching end-of-support in 2027 (extended to 2030 for a fee), remaining on-premises means higher costs, limited innovation, and growing compliance risk.

The guide outlines four deployment models - full cloud, core hybrid, talent hybrid, and private cloud, explaining their implications for agility, cost, and integration. Rather than prescribing one path, we aimed to help organizations make informed decisions based on their readiness, vision, and business priorities.

The Clean Core Mindset

One of the most transformative ideas in the guide is the clean core principle. Over the years, we‚Äôve seen customers struggle under the weight of complex, customized systems. What once offered flexibility has become a barrier to agility.

A clean core approach, keeping systems close to SAP standard and building extensions via SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), is the antidote. It allows companies to innovate quickly, upgrade easily, and stay aligned with SAP‚Äôs continuous release cycles.

In practice, this means no longer customizing inside the core, but innovating around it through low-code and no-code extensions. The result: more stability, less technical debt, and a foundation that evolves with your business.

Integration: The Hidden Hero

If the clean core is the heart of cloud transformation, integration is its circulatory system. We devoted a large part of the guide to explaining SAP‚Äôs ‚Äúseven suite qualities,‚Äù which define how SAP applications work together with consistent UX (SAP Fiori), unified security, harmonized data models, embedded analytics, and coordinated lifecycle management with SAP Cloud ALM.

Integration might sound technical, but its impact is human. It‚Äôs what allows an HR manager to see accurate payroll data in real time, or a business leader to access predictive analytics without toggling between systems.

We also explored how SAP Business Data Cloud unites data from HR, finance, and operations through SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud, giving organizations a real-time, AI-ready foundation for decision-making. When HR data connects seamlessly to business data, organizations move from administration to intelligence.

It‚Äôs Not an IT Project, It‚Äôs a Change Journey

Perhaps the most important message in the guide is simple: moving to the cloud is not an IT project.

It‚Äôs an organizational change journey that touches every level of the enterprise. We‚Äôve seen that successful transformations happen when HR and IT work hand in hand, guided by a shared vision and strong leadership sponsorship.

That‚Äôs why we introduced the idea of Phase 0,  the critical preparation period before implementation begins. In this stage, organizations align on objectives, assess readiness, define governance, and build internal capability.

We also emphasized SAP Activate and RISE with SAP methodologies, which blend agile delivery with fit-to-standard design and continuous iteration. Transformation doesn‚Äôt end at go-live; it‚Äôs a living process that evolves with each new release.

The Human Side of Innovation

Technology matters, but so does experience. Employees today expect consumer-grade interactions at work -  mobile, intuitive, and personalized. That‚Äôs why we highlighted SAP‚Äôs investments in AI and experience-driven design across SAP SuccessFactors.

Our favorite example is Joule, SAP‚Äôs generative AI copilot. Joule simplifies HR tasks through natural language, helping employees check time-off balances, understand pay statements, or navigate learning content. For managers, it provides insights into performance trends and engagement levels.

Joule embodies the future of HR, where technology empowers people, not replaces them. Alongside it, SAP‚Äôs deep integration with Microsoft Teams and its mobile-first approach ensure that HR happens ‚Äúin the flow of work,‚Äù wherever employees are.

Tools That Turn Vision into Action

We knew that inspiration alone isn‚Äôt enough ‚Äî organizations need tools to act. That‚Äôs why Part Three of the guide focuses on practical enablers, including:

  • SAP Readiness Check: to assess current systems and identify dependencies before migration.
  • HCM ROI Calculator: to quantify value and build the business case.
  • SAP Cloud ALM: for implementation governance and lifecycle management.
  • Infoporter and CSV Migration Tools: for seamless data transfer from SAP ERP HCM to SAP SuccessFactors.

We also pointed readers toward SAP Best Practices packages and partner tools on SAP Store, ensuring that no one has to start from scratch. Transformation is a team sport  - and SAP‚Äôs ecosystem of partners and user communities makes that collaboration possible.

Lessons We Learned Along the Way

Writing the guide taught us as much as it aims to teach others. A few insights stand out:

  • Transformation is human first. Technology succeeds only when people are ready and empowered to use it.
  • Simplicity is a superpower. A clean core and standardized processes create the freedom to innovate.
  • Integration equals intelligence. When systems connect, decision-making improves.
  • Data is destiny. Clean, well-governed data fuels AI, analytics, and business agility.

Perhaps the biggest lesson is that transformation is ongoing. Cloud adoption is not the end -  it‚Äôs the beginning of continuous improvement, innovation, and value realization.

Looking Ahead

The journey from SAP ERP HCM to SAP SuccessFactors represents more than a technological upgrade; it marks a philosophical shift in how organizations manage their most valuable asset ‚Äî their people.

Our hope is that this guide gives leaders not just the roadmap, but the confidence to take the first step. Whether an organization chooses a phased hybrid approach or a full cloud transformation, what matters most is momentum - the commitment to move forward with clarity and purpose.

Our team sees this work not as a conclusion but as an invitation: to keep learning, iterating, and collaborating as HR and IT evolve together. Because the future of work isn‚Äôt just digital -  it‚Äôs human at its core.

Download the complete guide: Charting a course from SAP ERP HCM to cloud-based human capital management solutions from SAP: A practical guide for Senior IT Leadership. 

We also invite you to join this conversation in the SAP Community and discover how organizations worldwide are redefining HR for the cloud era.

entry.title: Re: Query on Price Determination and Error Handling Durin...
entry.content:
Hi,

This behavior is standard system design.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the price determination process follows the standard pricing schema, where: The system reads condition records (e.g., from Contracts, Info Records) based on access sequences. If a valid PIR condition record exists (e.g., valid in EINE or condition tables), it is used for pricing ‚Äîirrespective of the contract validity, provided the condition validity in the PIR itself is valid for the PO date.

The system does not validate contract validity periods during PO price determination unless the PO is created with explicit reference to that contract. Hence, if the PO is not created with reference to the contract, or if the pricing schema still allows PIR conditions to be read, the system will use the PIR price even if the contract is expired.

Currently, there is no standard configuration option in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to automatically trigger a price error or warning if the contract validity period has expired while still allowing PIR-based pricing.

You may consider BAdI where you can Implement own checks before a purchase order is saved (BD_MMPUR_FINAL_CHECK_PO)

Thanks and regards,

Krithika

entry.title: Re: ODN Official Document Numbering fields in Migration C...
entry.content:
Why ODN fields are missing in templates is because, SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud uses predefined migration objects in the Migration Cockpit. The AP/AR open item templates do not expose the ODN field even if it's configured in the system. This is because ODN is typically system-generated during document posting, and not considered part of legacy data input.

Some recommended workarounds are

After migrating open items, use ‚ÄúPost Journal Entries‚Äù or ‚ÄúManage Journal Entries‚Äù to manually update the ODN field. This requires authorization to edit posted documents, and may be limited by Public Cloud restrictions.

If AR invoices are tied to eDocument numbers, ensure that the eDocument framework is active and configured. You may need to reprocess or regenerate eDocuments post-migration to align with legacy numbers.

One strategic tip would be if ODN values are critical for compliance or audit, consider storing them in a custom field or reference field during migration, and then mapping or linking them post-migration using a report or reconciliation logic.

entry.title: Re: Production order archive issue
entry.content:
Below are some possible reasons for INSMK change without direct log

1. System-Driven Update via Inspection Lot
Even if the inspection lot shows no issues, closing or usage decision on the lot can trigger a change in stock type (e.g., from quality to unrestricted). This update may reflect back on the production order‚Äôs stock assignment without logging a direct change in the order itself.

2. Indirect Change via Goods Movement (MB31 / MIGO)
A goods receipt or reversal posted against the production order could alter the stock type. These movements update INSMK but do not trigger a change log in the production order header or status.

3. Background Job or Enhancement Logic
Some systems have custom logic or user exits that adjust INSMK during batch jobs or cleanup routines. If such logic was triggered in the current year, it could silently update the stock type.

4. Change via CO02 Without Logging
If someone accessed the order via CO02 and changed the stock type on the goods receipt tab, it may not generate a change log unless the header or status was altered.

5. Archiving Pre-Check Logic
The archiving job may internally validate stock type and skip orders with non-standard INSMK values, even if the order is technically closed.

To investigate further

  • Check Goods Movement History: Use MB51 or COOIS to trace any movements linked to the order in the current year.
  • Review Inspection Lot Events: Use QA03 to see if any usage decisions or lot closures occurred recently.
  • Audit Enhancements: Review any custom logic in CO02, MB31, or archiving pre-check routines.
  • Use Table AUFK / AFKO: Compare timestamps and stock type fields to detect silent updates.

entry.title: Re: Question about scope item 3L5 and 3Y0 (Liquidity Plan...
entry.content:
Dear @ai_takahashi,

In scope for example 3L5 there are some prerequisites like master data, roles and set-up instructions (below link to PDF file)

 

https://support.sap.com/content/dam/SAAP/Sol_Pack/S4C/Library/Setup/3L5_Set-Up_EN_XX.pdf

J78 (Advanced Cash Operations) is not a prerequisite to activate or use 3L5 (Liquidity Planning) or 3Y0 (SAP Liquidity Planning for S/4HANA Cloud) in SAC. You can set up the S/4HANA<->SAC liquidity planning integration without J78.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/186460fdc35a4b64a713da9bb00deb1e/39e81b8f567d415185768de918b5092d.html?version=2508.500

 

When scope J78 is important:

  • Cash Management, some cash-ops apps and business catalogs (e.g., SAP_FIN_BC_CM_CASH_OPS_PC explicitly require scope item J78 to be active. If you need those apps/authorizations as part of your liquidity proces.

Link: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3465570

 

  • Liquidity analysis scenarios: On SAP Community i will find discuss liquidity analysis leveraging BFB (Basic Cash Operations) and/or J78. That indicates optionality based on desired functionality depth, not a hard dependency for SAC integration.

Link: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/liquidity-analysis-in-sap-s-4hana-cloud/ba-p/13534661

  • Additionally, the file

     

    does not show any dependencies or requirements to run the process

 

Recommendation:

  • If your goal is planning in SAC with data from S/4HANA Cloud (3Y0) and standard Liquidity Planning (3L5), you can proceed without J78.
  • Activate J78 only if you need the Advanced Cash Operations apps, authorizations, or the enhanced operational cash features in your process

Best Regards

Dawid

entry.title: Re: HOW TO MAKE CONTROL CODE (HSN CODE) AS MANDATORY FIEL...
entry.content:
Hi,

HSN/SAC code cannot be a mandatory field in Financial transactions.

As it is a localization field hence cannot be made part of the standard field status group.

Transaction could also be used for internal document postings example within a plant where GST number is not required in those case the field HSN/SAC cannot be made mandatory.

User has to enter HSN/SAC number manually.

 

Please submit an improvement request in the customer influence portal 

SAP Customer Influence enables customers to submit improvement requests and to openly vote on them.

These voting results inform SAP of product enhancements and changes customers are most interested in seeing in future releases.

1. Get started by opening SAP Customer Influence SAP Continuous Influence sessions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition

2. Register and accept the Terms of Use

3. Choose a session of your interest

4. Create and submit your improvement request

5. Take a look at existing improvement requests and start voting and commenting

Thanks and regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: SuccessFactors adapter not fetching data in SAP CPI
entry.content:
Hi Experts

I have a really strange bug.  There is an iflow in our system that is supposed to fetch and sync data from SuccessFactors to an external servers. The fetched data shows up as attachment in the CPI monitoring. It is working perfectly fine in our dev and test tenant. But when the client is trying to run it, it completes the run successfully but does not fetch any data at all. I am at a loss to understand what is going wrong. The endpoints they are using are exactly the same as ours. I asked them to run it in trace mode and share the results. Here is what they found -

This is showing up after a groovy script -

I am not sure why this error is coming up for them. Here is the "Set Content Name ppty" Script

/* Refer the link below to learn more about the use cases of script.
https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/148851bf8192412cba1f9d2c17f4bd25.html

If you want to know more about the SCRIPT APIs, refer the link below
https://help.sap.com/doc/a56f52e1a58e4e2bac7f7adbf45b2e26/Cloud/en-US/index.html */
import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;
import java.util.HashMap;
import groovy.json.JsonSlurper;
import groovy.json.JsonOutput;
import groovy.json.*;


def Message processData(Message message) {
    //Body
    def body = message.getBody(java.lang.String) as String;
    def jsonSlurper = new JsonSlurper();
    def payload = jsonSlurper.parseText(body);
    
    if (payload['root']['value'] == "") {
        message.setProperty("contentName", 'Not found');
    } else {
        def tyOfValue = payload['root']['value']['componentTypeID']
        message.setProperty("contentName", tyOfValue);
        
    }
    
    
    return message;
}

 For context, they are getting the payload when trying via postman. I am completely lost on this and any help will be appreciated.

Thank You

entry.title: Re: UPDATE PAN ON VENDOR MASTER DATA
entry.content:
Hello @acnascimento_06101,

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the India PAN field (J_1IPANNO) on Supplier: Country-Specific (India) is not available via API_BUSINESS_PARTNER, and no supported BAdI exists for customising it. SAP KBA confirms No API to Retrieve PAN in Supplier Country Specific Enh Tab ‚Äî https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3573075

What should you do?

Maintain via UI: Maintain Business Partner ‚Üí Supplier (Fin. Accounting) ‚Üí Supplier: Country-Specific (India).

Mass updates (if available in your tenant template): Manage Mass Maintenance ‚Äì Business Partners (New)-https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/ee9ee0ca4c3942068ea584d2f929b5b1/a20bc500ed9b47658a148c50d72d6062.html

Read/report PAN (not update) via CDS: use I_Supplier ‚Üí field BUSINESSPARTNERPANNUMBER ‚Äî KBA: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3584814

If this is business-critical, you might open an SAP incident and submit a Customer Influence request to expose PAN in the BP API.

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: HTTP Content Server all communication via SAP server?
entry.content:
We found the following:
The SAP TCODE OAG1/OAG4 setting of

'Deactivate Data Provider Cache' influence if SAP IP or Client IP arrived on 3rd party content server.

 

  • Unchecked:      'Deactivate Data Provider Cache'  SAP IP showing up in 3rd party content server
  • Checked:            'Deactivate Data Provider Cache' End User Client IP shows up in 3rd party content server.

 

SAP help on this:

Deactivate data provider cache

 Access Without Data Provider

Indicator that controls whether the URL for a displayed document is temporarily stored in the cache on the SAP application server.

 Indicator not set (standard setting): The URL is stored in the cache.

Indicator set: The URL is not stored in the cache.

  

We notice on other customer and the SAP community said: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/oag1-transaction-settings-effects/ba-p/12950339

The recommendation is to set it (that is, deactivate the DP cache). I've found many problems when the DP cache its used, i.e the DP_ERROR_GENERAL is definetively related with the DP Cache and most of the times simply checking this flag solves the issue (as explained in SAP note 1503002). On the past, it was more difficult to clean the cache since that option did not exist on OAG1 and it has to be cleaned with the help from note 629139

-------------------------
So bottom line is that the OAG1 cache setting setting make a difference but might come with DP Cache errors (DP_ERROR_GENERAL)

entry.title: Re: Create billing documents from sales orders, not deliv...
entry.content:
Hello @KK9221 

No, not in standard Public Cloud. For items with shipment (stock or physical goods), billing is related to delivery: you generate the invoice from the outbound delivery after PGI, not from the sales order. This follows the standard Sell from Stock (BD9) process. SAP Learning-Understanding the Sell from Stock Process

Why ‚ÄúCopying Control‚Äù Will Not Help Here. In S/4HANA Public Cloud, copying control is limited and does not alter an item‚Äôs billing relevance. Shippable items are billed at the time of delivery, while order-billed items typically include non-delivery services or billing plans. SAP Support Portal-3269803 - Unable to add new Copying Control for Sales and Billing Documents - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

If you need to bill before delivery, utilise down payment requests, pro-forma invoices, or Transition to an order-related billing scenario, such as 2EQ Sale of Services or billing plans; however, the item in question is not relevant to delivery. SAP Help Portal-Extensibility for Electronic Document Processing-Testing the New Process

With best regard

Chuma

entry.title: Assistance Required to Modify NACHA File Format as per Bank Requirements
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

I have a requirement to modify the NACHA file as per the bank‚Äôs specifications. The bank requires both the Credit and Debit lines to be included within the Entry Detail Record (6) section.

According to their clarification:

  • A line starting with ‚Äú22‚Äù represents the Credit line, which records the credit side of the transaction (e.g., the vendor or payee account being credited).

  • A line starting with ‚Äú27‚Äù represents the Debit line, which records the debit side of the transaction (e.g., the company‚Äôs account being debited).

By default, the standard NACHA file only includes the credit line information. I have modified the file to add a separate section for the debit lines, and it now correctly displays both credit and debit lines.

However, I have encountered an issue in the Batch Control Total (8) section. The field ‚ÄúEntry / Addenda Count‚Äù currently shows only the total number of credit lines, whereas it should display the total count of both credit and debit lines. Similarly, the ‚ÄúEntry Hash‚Äù field is also calculating only the total of credit lines, and it should reflect the combined total of both credit and debit entries.

Due to these discrepancies, the corresponding totals in the File Control Record (9) section are also incorrect.

I have attached a sample output file provided by the bank for your reference. Could you please guide me on how to adjust the NACHA file logic to include both credit and debit lines in the Entry / Addenda Count and Entry Hash fields?

Thank you for your assistance.
